Package eu.h2020.helios_social.core.contextualegonetwork

Class ContextualEgoNetwork

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.h2020.helios_social.core.contextualegonetwork.ContextualEgoNetwork
  • public class ContextualEgoNetwork
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements a Contextual Ego Network, which is the conceptual model of our Heterogeneous Social Graph. It contains information about the various contexts, i.e. the different layers of the multi-layer network, and about the nodes (users) that belong to the contexts. Moreover, it divides the contexts into a current one, some active ones (that are kept in memory) and some inactive ones (that are serialized in dedicated files).
    Author:
    Emmanouil Krasanakis (maniospas@iti.gr), Barbara Guidi (guidi@di.unipi.it), Andrea Michienzi (andrea.michienzi@di.unipi.it)

      • createOrLoad

        public static ContextualEgoNetwork createOrLoad​(java.lang.String internalStoragePath,
                                                java.lang.String egoName,
                                                java.lang.Object egoData)
        Deprecated.
        Prefer createOrLoad(Storage, String, Object), which this method wraps. This method remains only to ensure compatibility with previous versions and may be removed in future versions.
        Instantiates a ContextualEgoNetwork at the given storage path by creating a new ego node with the given data. Loads a previously saved one if such a node exists. Since method version 1.1.0 this method depends on the storage management of NativeStorage.
        Parameters:
        internalStoragePath - The path to the internal storage location (can be any path)
        egoName - The name of the ego network's ego.
        egoData - The data with which to create the network's node.
        Returns:
        the created or loaded contextual ego network

      • createOrLoad

        public static ContextualEgoNetwork createOrLoad​(Storage storage,
                                                java.lang.String egoName,
                                                java.lang.Object egoData)
        Instantiates a ContextualEgoNetwork at the given storage path by creating a new ego node with the given data. Loads a previously saved one if such a node exists.
        Parameters:
        internalStoragePath - The path to the internal storage location (s)
        egoName - The name of the ego network's ego.
        egoData - The data with which to create the network's node.
        Returns:
        the created or loaded contextual ego network

      • getSerializer

        public Serializer getSerializer()
        Retrieves the Serializer responsible for saving and loading the ego network and its entities.
        Returns:
        The Serializer object used to save and load data in the folder determined by #getPath()

      • save

        public void save()
        Makes the getSerializer() save the contextual ego network. This includes all explicitly serializeable objects, namely the contexts and nodes. Only Context.isLoaded() contexts are saved, since otherwise they would have already been saved with Context.cleanup().

      • cleanup

        public void cleanup()
        Applies Context.cleanup() to all contexts. Non-saved changes are lost.
        See Also:
        save()

      • getOrCreateContext

        public Context getOrCreateContext​(java.lang.Object data)
        Returns a context that satisfies data.equals(context.getData()) . Overriding the Object.equals(Object) function of the query data can be used to affect the outcome of the obtained context. If no such context exists, a new one is created.
        Parameters:
        data - The query data that the created context should hold.
        Returns:
        The found or newly created context.

      • getContextBySerializationId

        public Context getContextBySerializationId​(java.lang.String serializationId)
        Searches all ContextualEgoNetwork contexts for one with the same serializationId assigned to it during serialization
        Parameters:
        serializationId - The serializationId of the context
        Returns:
        The found context, null if no such context found.

      • removeContext

        public void removeContext​(Context context)
        Removes a given context from the ContextualEgoNetwork's contexts. Note that removing a context does not remove any nodes from the network, even if those are not currently referenced by other contexts (because future contexts may use those nodes). However, it removes the context's saved file from storage. If the removed context is current context, the latter is also set to null. To avoid catastrophic missing references due to neglected saving, the network is forcefully saved after removing the node by calling its save() method.
        Parameters:
        context - The context to remove.

      • getContexts

        public java.util.ArrayList<Context> getContexts()
        Method to grant safe access to all contexts of the contextual ego network.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of contexts.

      • setCurrent

        public void setCurrent​(Context context)
        Method to set a context as the current context.
        Parameters:
        context - The context to be set as the current one, or null if no context should be active at the present time.

      • getOrCreateNode

        public Node getOrCreateNode​(java.lang.String nodeId)
        Searches for a node with the given id and, if no such node is found, creates a new one.
        Parameters:
        nodeId - The node's id
        Returns:
        The found or created node.
        See Also:
        getOrCreateNode(String, Object)

      • getOrCreateNode

        public Node getOrCreateNode​(java.lang.String nodeId,
                            java.lang.Object data)
        Searches for a node with the given id and, if no such node is found, creates a new one using the given data.
        Parameters:
        nodeId - The node's id
        data - The node's data (only used if a new node is created - can be null).
        Returns:
        The found or created node.

      • removeNodeIfExists

        public void removeNodeIfExists​(java.lang.String nodeId)
        Removes a node from the contextual ego network given its serialization id, which is the same as Node.getId(). This includes removing the node from both the list of alters, as well as potentially loading any unloaded all contexts (if so, they are unloaded afterwards). To avoid catastrophic missing references due to neglected saving, the network is forcefully saved after removing the node by calling its save() method. If no node with the given id is part of the network, none of the above happens.
        Parameters:
        nodeId - The serialization id of the node to remove.
